Once again we see the large, fast man jogging toward came with a desperate look on his face, pouring a bottle of ch man's back, smothering him with the cloth and holding on the fight and collapses. Ace casually checks the ring, th
Ace sits in a lawn chair depressed. Melissa consoles him.
Ace, that stone could have come from anywhere. An earring, a necklace...
(with murder in his eyes) It came from an '82 AFC Championship ring.
Lt. Einhorn thinks it was an animal rights group. Have you heard of FAN?
Free Animals Now? Started in 1982 by Chelsea Gamble, daughter of the famous industrialist, Fischer Gamble? Over half a million members from Florida to Finland? (beat) No. Who are they?
Did you know that last year they sent threatening letters to 127 college teams, demanding the release of their mascots? At last count
What do you feed your dog? We see Melissa's dog lying near Ace's feet.
Ah... dog food, why?
He's miserable.
What are you talking about?
He's just very unhappy, I feel sorry for him. Bad diet, isolated environment. It's amazing he's still alive.
You're just mad because your stupid pebble theory didn't work out and you don't know how to express your anger.
Yeah? And you're ugly.
I'm not even gonna' talk to you, please leave.
What, so you can beat him? Fatty!
You... are unbelievable. The phone rings inside the house. Melissa goes to answer
Hiring you was a huge mistake! The door slams and Ace is alone with the dog. After a mom all see that it is one of the happiest dogs in the world.
You like her, huh?... Yeah, she's alright. Ace, feeling guilty, walks into the house.
Ace walks toward Melissa.
Look, Melissa, I, ah... Ace stops when he sees Melissa. She is sitting, holding t stunned look on her face. Something is very wrong.
Chaos. Police, lights flashing, paramedics, crowds of peo Ace and Melissa see Roger Podacter's body taken away in a
You okay? Melissa nods bravely. Emilio joins them.
What'd you find?

Podacter, Roger. Routine suicide. He was alone. He'd been drinking. No sign of a struggle. Neighbor heard him scream on the way down. Just your classic fifteen story swan dive. Melissa shudders. Ace gives Emilio a "way to go" look.
Sorry.
The three enter. Emilio pushes the button for the elevato
It just seems so out of character. He was going to retire in two years.
Did he leave a note? The elevator arrives.
No. That's nothing unusual. Some do, some don't. He didn't. The elevator doors close.
Police are everywhere. Emilio, Ace and Melissa enter and the officers.
Miss Robinson, this is officer Carlson.
Evening, ma'am. I wonder if you could answer a few questions about the deceased? Ace slips away, we follow him as he eavesdrops on convers
(to a cop) I told you, I was across the hall in my apartment, I heard a scream. The door was locked, so I called the manager... The Manager reiterates her story to the cop. The Manager

...The place was empty, except for the damn dog in the other room. Then I opened the balcony door, looked over the railing, and... splat, bang, pancake time... Ace, continuing his investigation notices...
in perfect order. Next, he notices police coming in and out of the balcony, out the noise.
A dog is cowering in the corner. Ace tries to comfort the
Hey, fella, have a bad night? Ace examines its paws. Ace then gets down and finds scratches in the door. TWO F Ace stands. He is face to face with Einhorn.
Who let Dr. Doolittle in? Emilio steps in immediately.
Ah, Lieutenant. He came with Miss Robinson
This is official police business. We'll let you know if the coroner finds any ticks. Cops snicker.
I just thought since Melissa
E, forget it. She's right. Besides, I wouldn't want someone tracing my steps and pointing out all the mistakes I made. Ace crosses to...
Ace examines the area. Einhorn is in hot pursuit.
Oh, so, you don't think this in an obvious suicide, Mr. Pet Detective?

Well, I wouldn't say that. Lord knows, there is plenty of evidence here to support your theory, except of course that spot of blood on the balcony. On the railing, sure enough, there is a tiny spot of bloo Einhorn glares at a couple of nearby cops. They look down
May I tell you what I think happened? Alrighty then! Ace moves as he talks.

Roger Podacter went out after work. He had a few drinks, and he came home. But he wasn't alone.  Someone was with him in this apartment. There was a struggle, and then Roger Podacter was thrown over that balcony. Roger Podacter didn't commit suicide. He was murdered. A beat as everyone considers this.
Well, that's a very entertaining story, but real detectives have to worry about that little thing lawyers call evidence. Ace picks up a lottery ticket on Podacter's desk and beco

Let's take a trip to clue corner, shall we? Can anyone tell me why a man buys a lottery ticket on the day he is going to commit suicide? Or why the family pet, suffering from acute canine trauma, clawed at the bedroom door until his paws bled? How about the blood on the railing? I'll bet if we put our thinking caps on we'll see that it was the result of the struggle that took place inside this apartment while Mr. Podacter was still alive! (singing)

head_text.subj: NEXT TIME YOU DON'T HAVE A CLUE
COME ON BACK TO CLUE CORNER

text: Everyone looks to Einhorn.

Not a bad try for a pet detective, but not near conclusive enough for us real investigators. (beat) First, people buy lottery tickets everyday. It's a habit. It doesn't prove a thing. Second, the dog wasn't suffering from canine trauma, he was suffering from bladder trauma. Sergeant Neilson found a piss stain as big as Lake Huron near the bed. And third, the blood on the railing. Simple. He doesn't jump far enough and whacks his head. A fact confirmed by the paramedics who found cuts on his scalp, with traces of a white chalky substance. i.e. plaster from the balcony. Einhorn shows Ace the paramedics report. Everyone is impr
So much for your murder, Ventura.
Uh oh, I think I heard a toilet flush. Maybe someone lost their turtle? Everyone has a laugh. Ace looks beaten.
Well, maybe I'm just a little out of my league, here. Einhorn... Ace holds out his hand, Einhorn shakes it.
...good work. Ace and Melissa head for the door.

Oh, there is just one more thing, Lieutenant. (re: the neighbor) This man is Roger Podacter's neighbor. He lives across the hall. He said he heard a scream, is that right, sir? The neighbor nods. Ace turns to the apartment manager.
And you said you had to open the balcony door when you keyed into the room?
That's right. Ace walks out onto the balcony and turns, facing them.
You're certain you had to open this door? She nods.
What's the point, Ventura?
Only this... AAAAAAAWWWWWWWWWWW... Ace sustains an incredible Pavorati note, while he repeat between them. When the door is closed nothing can be hear

(tapping the door) This is double paned, sound- proofed glass. There's no way this neighbor could have heard Podacter scream on the way down with this door shut. The scream he heard came from inside this apartment, before Podacter was thrown over the railing! And the muderer closed the door before he left! (celebrates insanely) Yes! Yesss! I have exorcised the demons! (a la Poltergeist) This house is clear.
Ace drives straight ahead.
What are you thinking?
I'm thinking this whole thing is connected somehow. (frustrated) I'm thinking I want to find that other ring!
You checked all the rings.
I know, Pessimistress. Could anyone else have gotten a ring that year?
No. Camp was the only honoree. Just players and coaches. Everyone in the photo.
...Receipts! There must be receipts! You have a key to the office.
Ace this has been a really tough day. Can't we do this in the morning? Ace looks at his watch.
Absolutely.
Ace's car screeches to a stop, in front of the building.
It's dark. Team pictures adorn the walls.
These files go back to seventy- eight.
Ace is flipping through a file cabinet, looking at receip
That was pretty impressive, what you did back at the apartment.
(still looking) You don't have to tell me. I was there.
Maybe you should have joined the police force... become a real detective.
(shaking his head) I don't do humans. Melissa gets a bit closer.
You really love animals, don't you? Ace stops searching and looks into her eyes.
I feel a kinship with them. I understand them. Wanna hear something kinda spooky?
Sure. She gets closer still.

One time, when I was about twelve, I had this dream that I was being followed by a dog with rabies. He had these really bloodshot eyes and foam coming out of his mouth... and just before I got to my front door... he jumped on me and sunk his teeth in. Then I woke up, and felt the back of my neck... check this out. Ace motions for Melissa to feel the back of his neck, but barking like a vicious dog.
Melissa jumps out of her skin.
Ohhh!! You bastard!
(snickering) I'm sorry. I couldn't stop myself. Are these all the receipts?
(mildly annoyed) I don't know.
There's only a dozen of them here. Ace turns from the file cabinet with a hopeless look on h mess.
(pointedly) Gee... maybe they were misplaced because somebody didn't put the files back when he was...
Who the hell is that?
What... Ace crosses to a big picture of the '82 team that hangs o player.
That! Who the hell is that?! He quickly pulls out his crossed out pictures of the team
Oh, that's Ray Finkle... the kicker. Don't you know who Ray Finkle is?
No! How come he's not in this picture?! Melissa checks Ace's photo.
This was the picture you were using? This was taken earlier in the year. Finkle wasn't added to the roster till mid-season. She starts to realize what Ace has already figured out.
He's the guy that missed the final field goal in the Super Bowl that year. Cost the Dolphins the game.
But he got a ring?
Definitely.
Ace and Melissa look through Finkle's file on a microfich flash before them...
'Replacement Kicker Having Great Year'... 'Ready For Super Bowl, Confident Kicker Boasts'.
'Field Goal Sails Wide, Dolphins Lose Super Bowl'.
The kick heard round the world. That was Finkle. The Dolphins lost by one point. Another headline hits the screen: FINKLE CONTRACT NOT REN
Poor guy.
Poor guy with a motive, baby. Where is he now?
Last I heard, he went back to his home town, Collier County. He used to work in a bar up there.
(pondering) REHEHEALLY.
Can you drop me off before you go?
(shaking his head) No way. It may not be safe at your apartment, and you shouldn't be left alone.
What do you suggest?
We see a person's butt under a sheet coming up into frame SKIN, SWEAT, SHEETS FLY,  as Ace and Melissa roll back an no prisoners.
50 animals at the bottom of the bed, with eyes as big as cut back and forth between furious lovemaking and shots o Melissa and Ace simultaneously reach the pinnacle of plea
(totally amazed and exausted) OH man... oh man! Oh wow!
(mock embarrassment) I'm sorry... that's never happened to me before. I must be tired.

A pitifully sad country song plays on the radio. FERN BIL end of an old shotgun in his mouth. He is struggling to r Through the glass behind him, we see Ace's car pull up to DING! The bell rings. Fern begrudgingly takes the gun out out.
Ace gets out of his car.
Excuse me, sir. Do you know where I can find the Pigskin Sports Bar?
Do I have a "kick me" sign on my back, son?
I wouldn't know anything about that, but if you could point me toward the bar. Fern breaks down, sobbing.
They all left me... all of them!
Well... Hypothetically speaking, say they all left you and went to the Pigskin Sports Bar. How would they have gotten there from here?
Two miles down and take the first left.
Thanks very much! Take care now, 'bye 'bye then! Ace gets into his car and pulls out.
Fern enters, sits down at the desk, places the end of the trigger and... DING! Another car pulls up to the pump. Exasperated, he t
(murmers to himself as he gets up) Can't get anything done around here...
A weathered dive in the middle of a swamp. Ace parks.
If depression had a home, this is it. Several dejected me around the bar. A couple hapless guys play pool. One thro Ace enters, pops a sunflower seed in his mouth and addres
Excuse me, guy?! My name is Ace Ventura, I'm a pet detective. I'd like to ask you a few questions if I could. No one even looks at him.
Just a few questions, that's all. Still no one reacts.
(very up) Who wants gum?! Again, no reaction. Ace walks over to the bartender and s
I'm looking for a guy who used to work here. The bartender takes the money.
That right?
He was a kicker for the Dolphins. Ray Finkle. A pool ball flies by Ace's head shattering a mirror behin
(to guy who threw it) That would be a scratch.
You a friend of Finkle's?
(thinks) ...Yes? CRASH! The giant guy smashes his bottle.
Sorry, I have "say the opposite of what you mean" disease. Several undesirables surround Ace.
That bastard ruined this town.
Ewww... I hate that!
We bet everything we had on that Super Bowl and that son of a bitch gagged.
What a diiick! They all move closer in a threatening manner.
Shanked a goddamn 26 yarder!!!
Death to Finkle! Death to Finkle! The bartender steps in.

We had a hell of a thing going here. Tourists coming to see Ray Finkle's home town. He was standing right over there when he got the call from the Dolphins. The bartender points to a payphone. It has had the shit b think of is graffitied around it.
Did he come back after the Super Bowl?
Yeah... but the boys here had ways of letting him know he wasn't welcome.
Excuse me, I gotta take a wicked Finkle. Laughter.
What's the difference between Finkle and a jackass? A jackass can kick. More laughter.
Why did Finkle cross the road?!
(facetious) Wait...  I know this one.
He didn't! And I've got the hair on my bumper to prove it! Maniacal laughter and chanting ensues.
It's good you're dealing with the anger. (beat) I don't suppose anyone's seen him lately? The chanting stops and the guys all look at Ace.
No... but we know where his parents live! Don't we boys?!
Yeah! We sure do! They all laugh insanely again.
Ace pulls up outside a two-story stilt house. The place h bullet holes and paint bombs. Toilet paper is strewn thro on the door. A wooden peephole slides open revealing a su
...Hi, I'm looking for Ray Finkle. A gun slides out into Ace's face.
(with a gulp) And a clean pair of shorts. A deep gruff voice from inside.
What do you know about Ray Finkle?

Southpaw soccer style kicker. Graduated from Collier High in June, 1976. Stetson University honors graduate, class of 1980. Holds two NCAA division one records. One for most points in a season, one for distance. Former nickname The Mule. The first and only pro athlete ever to come out of Collier County. And one helluva model American. After a beat the peephole closes. The door slowly creaks unsmiling, taciturn, elderly man holding the gun.
Are you another one of them scumbags from 'Hard Copy'?
No, sir. I'm just a very big Finkle fan. This is my Graceland, sir. Mrs. Finkle, a sweet, adorable elderly woman comes over.
Will you put that gun down. The boy's a fan of our son. So nice to meet you. I'm Ray's mother, and this is Ray's father.
It's a real honor.
My Ray is so appreciative of his fans. He'll be so pleased you stopped by.
Are you expecting Ray anytime soon?
Oh, yes. I expect him home any minute. Ace is surprised.
Would you like some cookies? I just baked them. Mrs. Finkle hurries off to the kitchen. Ace smiles at Mr.
Wow... Ray Finkle's house! Can't wait to meet him!
Ray ain't comin' home.
But your wife said you expect him home any minute.
She expects him home any minute. He points to his head, and looks toward the kitchen.

Engines runnin but there's no one behind the wheel. Ten years ago our son escaped from Shady Acres Psychiatric Hospital in Tampa. They're still buggin' us to pick up his stuff. Mrs. Finkle returns with a plate of football shaped cooki

(sweetly) It was all that Dan Marino's fault, everyone knows that. If he had held the ball laces out, like you're supposed to, Ray would never have missed that kick. Dan Marino should die of Gonorrhea and rot in Hell. Would you like a cookie, son? Ace takes a cookie. Holding it up.
Hey, what do ya know. They're little footballs.
Laces OUT! CRASH!! A large stone smashes through the window. Outside patrons from the Pigskin Sports Bar drives by yelling the
I told you he had a lot of fans. Mrs. Finkle picks up the rock and hurls it out the broken knocking him out cold, as the truck peels away.
(aside to Ace) She got the arm. The boy got the leg.
Mrs. Finkle and Ace are walking down the hallway to Ray's
When Ray gets back and starts kicking again, he'll never even know he was gone. I kept his room just the way he left it. She opens the door to Ray's room. Ace steps in.
It's a death shrine to Dan Marino. Complete with lifesize nooses around the neck, other hacked to pieces. Painted o Marino must die!!!, etc.
...Oooh boy.
What a sports nut, huh? In the center of the room is a movie projector.
May I?
Oh yes. By all means. Mrs. Finkle shuts the lights off. Ace turns on the projec The film flickers over the "Marino must die!!!" graffiti. Marino takes the snap, Finkle kicks and the ball sails wi
Ace on the payphone. We see the gas station in the backgr
Melissa, it's Ace.
Ace? Where are you?
I'm in Psychoville and Finkle's the Mayor. Where's Dan Marino?
Marino? Why?
Because he's about to join Snowflake. I gotta know where he is.
Okay, hold on... Melissa checks Marino's itinerary. Ace waits, impatiently

(to himself) Come on. Come on... In the background, we see two paramedics exit the gas sta gurney. The area of the sheet that covers the face is a g good old Mr. Bilbo into an ambulance and drive away, ring doesn't notice.
Ah, he had practice. Then... he has a commercial shoot out at the Prescott Sound Stage.
Where is that?
It's on Route One by the Six Cut Off. Thirty minutes outside of town.
Okay, that's about fifteen miles from me. Call the police. Get extra security over there now.
Ace, tell me what's going on. (beat) Ace?... The payphone dangles off the hook. Ace is...
...in his car racing out of the swampland, his heaad now leaves a faded, old, barely legible sign in his wake:
The "F" in "FINKLE" has been replaced with "ST" in spray
Rehearsal for an Isotoner ad in progress.
...So I protect the hands that protect me. With Isotoners. Marino gets carted off by FIVE HUGE LINEMEN.
Good. Remember, exit camera right. That's to your left. Alright, let's get ready to shoot this. FIRST A.D. (to the linemen) Helmets on this time! The linemen disperse.
Ace runs a red light causing cars to skid in every direct

(to make-up girl) See, in 82 we just choked. We had a chance to win it and we didn't
Dan, are you ready?
Ah, sure. (to girl) I'll tell you later.
The cops race onto the lot.
Marino takes center stage. A.D. Quiet on the set... roll... speed...
...And action!
Hi, I'm Dan Marino. If anyone knows the value of protection, it's me... We see an old clip of Marino getting sacked.
Cops scramble on foot to the sound stage.
The commercial is winding up. The linemen ready themselve
...So I protect the hands that protect me. With Isotoners. The five linemen grab Marino and run off camera.
And cut! That was good. Again from one. But two of the linemen keep running with Marino...
I said cut!! ...And they keep running.
What the hell are they doing? ...Right out the studio door. Then the cops arrive and ra of the dressing room holding their heads.

Ace skids around a corner, looking way up ahead. He sees Marino being shoved into a black 81 Ford Bronco. The cops come out of the building on foot. Too late. Ace in hot pursuit almost runs the cops down.
(yelling at cops) S'cuse meee! Pet Detective!
Ace's head is out the driver's window through the entire guys, they start shooting. Ace wisely puts his head insid

Ace's car smashes through benches and tables. Then it fli wheels with a horrid SMASH. Ace is still strapped into th Ace's prized WHITE PIGEON lands on the car door right bes sees the bird. Then, with a sudden quick lunge he success about Marino.
I did it! I did it! I caught the white pigeon! I caught the white pigeon! Ace jumps out of his car and starts skipping around the p head. He looks insane.

(singing) I caught the white pigeon, I caught the white pigeon, I caught the white... Ace slows down and begins to look around warily. There ar perched on the telephone wires around the park and on the The sky grows darker. He slowly turns and tries to get ba Ace sets the white pigeon free and starts to run, but it' and gouging, and ripping his flesh. Now we see ten birds flying away with a leg. Five birds f are trying to take Ace's left arm off, and half his face
Ace is back in his wrecked car with his arm hanging out t
Hey mister. Hey mister. Ace come to suddenly, and looks at the boy with a crazed
That was a really neat crash, mister. Do it again! Ace sighs with relief.
Various headlines hit the news stands: "MARINO KIDNAPPED"
Marino stands with several Space Aliens in football gear.
A chaotic press conference. Zillions of REPORTERS shout a
Lieutenant, have there been any ransom demands?
There's been no communication with the kidnappers at this time.
What's going to happen to the Super Bowl? Will it be postponed?
As of now, the game is going on as scheduled.
Why wasn't the public told about Snowflake's kidnapping?
Secrecy was essential. We didn't want any public interference.
Are the crimes related? And what about Roger Podacter's murder?
I'm sorry. I can't comment any further. Now if you'll excuse me. Einhorn pushes her way through the crowd of reporters.
Einhorn is barking out orders to other cops as she heads
Emilio, get me the autopsy on Podacter! Aguado, send out a memo. No one talks to the press...
...And somebody get me a cup of coffee!
(TV announcer's voice) Tonight on "MIAMI VICE", Crockett geets the boss coffee! Ace is in her office, popping sunflower seeds, kicking ba bathroom.
Ventura, when I get out of this bathroom, you better be gone.
Is it number one or number two? Einhorn turns and glares at Ace.
I just want to know how much time I have. Einhorn goes to the sink and begins washing her hands.
Oh, by the way, I went ahead and solved that pesky, Snowflake/Podacter/Marino thing.
(humoring him) Oh yeah?
yeah, ever hear of a former Dolphin kicker named Ray Finkle? The water shuts off. Einhorn appears around the corner.
Alright, Ventura. Make it quick.

I found a rare stone at the bottom of Snowflake's tank. It's from a Dolphin '82 AFC Championship ring. It would have been a Super Bowl ring, but Ray Finkle missed the big kick. Blames the whole thing on Marino. We're talking paranoid, delusional psychosis. I saw the guy's room... Cozy, if you're Hannibal Lector.
So how does Roger Podacter fit in?

My guess is Finkle was snooping around. Podacter recognized him. End of story. As for Snowflake... they gave him Finkle's number, and taught him how to kick a field goal. Finkle took it personally. Einhorn listens with great interest.
So where is Finkle, now?

He broke out of a metal hospital. Did a Claude Raines. He's been planning his revenge for years. Waiting for the perfect time to get back at the Dolphins. The time when it would hurt them the most. Super Bowl time! Man, I'm tired of being right! Einhorn walks in front and sits on the edge of the desk.
Congratulations. You've done some fine detective work, Ace.
Ahh, could you talk in my good ear. I thought I heard you call me Ace. Einhorn gets real close.
Maybe I was wrong about you. Maybe you are more than just a pet dick.

text: ACE. Objects are knocked off the desk as they lean back.
Your gun's digging into my hip. More kissing, the Ace stops.
(still coming on) What's wrong, Ace? Want me to read you your rights?
Maybe later.
What is it? That bony little bitch, Melissa Robinson?
(defensive) No. You just don't do anything for me. He quickly adjusts his crotch, to conceal the erection. E
I'll be here if you ever want a real woman. There's a sharp KNOCK at the door.
What is it? Aguado opens the door.
Everything okay in here?  Heard some commotion.
Fine, Sergeant.
You want me to throw him out?
Why don't you throw yourself out.
...Yes, ma'am. A crestfallen Aguado exits. Ace heads for the door.
Ace, I want you to leave everything to us.
Can't do that, Lieutenant. I was hired to find Snowflake.
When we find Marino, We'll deliver Snowflake.
When I find Snowflake, I'll deliver Marino. He exits.
A full on thrash metal band is cranking on stage. Kids le Burnout is still thrashing his head wildly to the music.
(shouting) Nice to see you again! The Burnout just keeps thrashing. Ace spots Woodstock wat
St. Francis, how's it goin'?
(kidding) That's none of your damn business.
Isn't it?
Is it?
Anything new on that dolphin?
Got his picture on some tuna cans, but nothing so far. A singer ROARS on stage. He sounds like a garbage disposa
Arroohhghhh! Myrrrooohghhhh! Geroooghhh!
So, what can I do for you today?
I need info on a football flunky named Ray Finkle.
Sorry, Ace, I can't help you right now. I gotta watch this band! They are the shit!
Are they?
Aren't they?

Alright then. Don't worry about it. I mean dolphins aren't exactly an endangered species. It's not like the whole food chain's gonna be affected if one highly intelligent mammal dies a slow and painful death! Hell, if the band is loud enough, you won't even hear its pitiful whimpering!! Ace does his best suffering dolphin impression. Woodstock
Woodstock is at his computer. Ace looks over his shoulder appears on the screen.
This guy's last reported income was September, 1982.
Well then. We know he's incredibly thrifty.
Is he?

Well, I think we can be pretty sure he's involved in the kidnapping of the dolphin.
Really? What makes you say that?
There's two-thousand dollars worth of smelts on his VISA card. After a beat Ace realizes it was a bad joke.
Please yank me no further. I beg of you.
Alright already. The last time this guy used his credit card was June, '84. He rented a car from Avis. And... eww... he was a bad boy. They found it abandoned two months later in South Miami.
Anything else?
Nope.
Well... you did all you could. Thanks for nothin.
Hey man, according to this, your friend Ray Finkle doesn't exist.
Hmm, I know what that's like.
Do you?
Don't I?
Ace emerges from the basement. The band is between songs. head has now stopped.

(to burnout) Did you get all the spiders outta there? Ace heads out, then freezes. The two thugs that took Mari see Ace and start towards him, reaching inside their coat Suddenly the music starts. (screams)

Who is it?
Ira.
Ira who?
I refuse to do a 'knock knock joke'. Come on, open up! Melissa opens the door.
Ace, what are you doing? It's the middle of the night!
You have to commit me.
Ace's clunker speeds down the highway.
Finkle escaped from Shady Acres in Tampa. They still have some of his stuff.
So you think they're going to let us just waltz in and look around?
